lead_paragraph: Oklahoma City accepted a $3.8 million settlement offer yesterday to cover its expenses during the New Orleans Hornets’ temporary relocation and its share of revenue. The offer, approved unanimously by the mayor and the City Council, also includes terms for this season in Oklahoma City and an option for a third in case they cannot return to New Orleans as planned in 2007-8.
